questions.question: The room was ………………………….. hot that I could not sleep at all.
questions.description: We cannot use too or very before a that-clause.

questions.question: She is ……………………………. polite a person to refuse.
questions.description: Note the pattern too..to. We can also express this idea using so. She is so polite that she cannot refuse.

questions.question: The trains are …………………………. crowded.
questions.description: Either could be used to talk about extremes.

questions.question: There were far …………………………….. many applicants for the job.
questions.description: The expression too many can be modified by far.

questions.question: She was …………………………. upset that she did not talk to anybody.
questions.description: Only so is possible before a that-clause.

questions.question: The water is …………………………… salty that we cannot drink it.
questions.description: Only so is possible before a that-clause.

questions.question: You have always been ……………………………. kind to me.
questions.description: We cannot use too much before an adjective without a noun.

questions.question: We arrived ……………………………… late to have dinner.
questions.description: We cannot use too much before an adjective without a noun.

questions.question: He is a …………………………… intelligent child.
questions.description: We cannot use so before adjective + noun.

questions.question: We shall be …………………………. pleased if you can spend a few days with us.
questions.description: The expression only too can mean very.

questions.question: You ask …………………………………… too many questions.
questions.description: We can use far to modify too many. Much is not used before too many.

questions.question: We got ……………………………… answers to our advertisement.
